meanings.definition: To convert into money or cash
meanings.sent1: She decided to monetize her old clothes by selling them online.
meanings.sent2: The artist was able to monetize his paintings by selling them at a gallery.
meanings.sent3: Trying to monetize a broken piggy bank would be quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: He found a way to monetize his creativity, turning it into a profitable venture.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to monetize ordinary objects into gold coins.

meanings.definition: To make money from a business or asset
meanings.sent1: The company sought to monetize their new app through in-app purchases.
meanings.sent2: Investors were eager to monetize their shares in the successful startup.
meanings.sent3: It was a clever move to monetize the unused office space by renting it out.
meanings.sent4: She had a knack for monetizing her baking skills, turning them into a profitable bakery.
meanings.sent5: The entrepreneur's goal was to monetize his innovative idea and turn it into a successful business.

meanings.sent1: The savvy investor knew how to monetize the fluctuations in the stock market.
meanings.sent2: By renting out his vacation home, he was able to monetize his property effectively.
meanings.sent3: Trying to monetize a lemonade stand during a snowstorm would be quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: She found a way to monetize her passion for gardening, selling her produce at the local market.
meanings.sent5: The author's goal was to monetize her writing skills and turn them into a successful career.
